quote_first:
Only the hoot of a belated car faintly disturbed the silence.
I looked at my wrist-watch. This showed
quote_last:
. As I raised my eyes, an impatient clock somewhere confirmed its tale.
With a yawn I conjured the terrier to go to sleep and reached for the switch.
As I did so, he growled again.
title: Berry and Co.
author: Dornford Yates

“
quote_last:
.”
“In the morning?”
Herera’s friend leered at her. “No, there’s a total eclipse of the sun.”
title: Freedom
author: Jonathan Frantzen

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes

quote_first: I looked attentively at her, as she put that singular question to me. It was then
quote_last: . All I could discern distinctly by the moonlight was a colourless, youthful face, meagre and sharp to look at about the cheeks and chin; large, grave, wistfully attentive eyes; nervous, uncertain lips; and light hair of a pale, brownish-yellow hue.
title: The Woman in White
author: Wilkie Collins
